message.accountLogoutConfirm:
Please make sure push notifications are disabled before logging out of an account, otherwise you may continue to get push notifications for that account.

Are you sure you want to logout {{0}}?
message.pushNotificationsConfirm:
To make push notifications work, Memmy has to send your authentication token to our server. Right now, this is the only viable way to allow users to receive push notifications. Note that Memmy servers do NOT have access to your password, only your authentication token. Authentication tokens may be revoked by changing your password.

Full source code for the Memmy push notification server is available at https://github.com/gkasdorf/memmy-push.

Do you wish to continue?
message.deleteAccountConfirm:
To remove all data from Memmy's servers, simply disable push notifications. If you do not have push notifications enabled, we do not have any of your data.

To delete your Lemmy account, you must first visit {{0}} and sign in. Then navigate to the Profile tab. You may delete your account by pressing "Delete Account".

nsfw.footer: These settings do not affect your Lemmy account NSFW settings. These setting will only apply to the local app (globally on all accounts).

markRead.footer: Hide Read Posts on Feed will automatically hide read posts anytime the feed is refreshed. If Hide Read Posts on Feed is enabled, Show Hide Read Button will show a floating action button to hide read posts without a feed refresh.

server.footer: URL for the server you wish to connect

credentials.footer: Credentials for the server you are connecting to

filters.description: Filters allow you to filter posts from your feed based on specific keywords in the title or instances of origin

onboarding.agreeToTermsOfUse: By using Memmy, you agree to the <linkAction><linkText>Terms of Use</linkText></linkAction>

1.1: Do you already know about the Fediverse?

2.2: Let's help guide you through it 😃

3.1: Let‚Äôs think of the Fediverse like a postal service ‚úâÔ∏è
3.2: When you use apps like Instagram, Twitter or Facebook, they <emphasis>exclusively handle the mail for you.</emphasis>
3.3: Everyone receives and sends mail through them. They are <emphasis>centralized.</emphasis>

4.1: So how is the Fediverse different? 🤔
4.2: Your mail doesn't go to one central place, but to your <emphasis>hub</emphasis>, a sort of <emphasis>local post office</emphasis>.
4.3: Your <emphasis>hub</emphasis> is responsible for sending your mail to other <emphasis>hubs</emphasis>. They can pick who <emphasis>they wish to send it to</emphasis> 🚚

5.2: A <emphasis>hub</emphasis> can be started by anyone, like a community group. You choose which one you want to <emphasis>join</emphasis>.
5.3: We will help you select a hub and start posting in it. 🤗

6.2: This can feel complex. <emphasis>But you have already used the Fediverse before.</emphasis>
6.3: As long as you have used e-mail, <emphasis>you have used the Fediverse.</emphasis>
6.4: The Fediverse operates in a <emphasis>very similar way to how e-mail works.</emphasis>

7.2: We‚Äôll first set you up with a hub. We‚Äôll give you a list of options to pick from.
7.3: There are many options available with many different communities.
7.4: You can later go back to instance selection to choose another hub.

createCommunities.allowed: This hub allows user created communities.
createCommunities.notAllowed: This hub doesn't allow user created communities.

federated.allowed: This hub can interact with other hubs.
federated.notAllowed: This hub can't interact with other hubs.

downvote.title: Downvotes Allowed
downvote.allowed: This hub allows users to downvote.
downvote.notAllowed: This hub doesn't allow users to downvote.

memmyError.title: Well that's awkward. Memmy encountered an error. Please restart the app...
memmyError.description: We don't like bugs and you probably don't either. If you don't mind, could you please submit the logs? ‚ô•Ô∏è
